action.action-desc: Mr. Gooden of Texas (for himself, Mr. Mast, and Mr. Bean of Florida) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To amend title 23, United States Code, with respect to the operation of certain specialized hauling vehicles on the Interstate System, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Carrying Automobiles Responsibly and Safely Act or the CARS Act.

section.header: Operation of certain specialized hauling vehicles on Interstate
section.text: Section 127 of title 23, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

subsection.header: Operation of certain specialized hauling vehicles on the Interstate

paragraph.text: A State may not prohibit the operation of a stinger-steered combination automobile transporter with a gross weight of 88,000 pounds or less onâ€”

subparagraph.text: any segment of the Interstate System (except a system exempted under section 31111(f) of title 49); or
the classes of qualifying Federal-aid primary highways designated by the Secretary under section 31111(e) of title 49.

paragraph.text: No State may enact or enforce a law denying reasonable access to stinger-steered combination automobile transporters, to and from highways described in paragraph (1), to loading or unloading points or facilities for food, fuel, repair, and rest.
A State shall allow a stinger-steered combination automobile transporter an increase of not more than 10 percent on the axle weight limitations set forth in subsection (a).

In this subsection, the term stinger-steered combination automobile transporter means a truck tractor semitrailer wherein the fifth wheel is located on a drop frame located behind and below the rear-most axle of the power unit.
